author: Jeffry Bartash
title: Economic Report: High inflation harkens back to the 1980s. Here is what’s similar – and different
description: The yearly rate of U.S. inflation --- measured by the consumer price index --- climbed to 6.8% as of November to mark the sharpest increase in prices in 39 years. A lot has changed in the past 40 years, of course, and Wall Street DJIA economists say comparing…

author: Jacob Passy
title: Economic Report: Existing-home sales decline amid listings shortage
description: Economists had anticipated that home sales would remain flat, following the emergence of the omicron variant.

author: Jeffry Bartash
title: Economic Report: Philly Fed factory index rebounds in January
description: The Philadelphia Federal Reserve’s index of manufacturing conditions rose by 8 points in January to 23.2 n a sign that businesses are still growing despite the omicron outbreak and persistent labor and supply shortages.

author: Mark DeCambre
title: Market Pulse: Dow, S&P 500 rise to fresh records to start Tuesday trade
description: The Dow and the S&P 500 head sharply higher Tuesday, after investors kicked off the new year by pushing those pair of major benchmarks to record finishes.

author: Jeffry Bartash
title: Economic Report: New York economy sags in January, Empire State survey shows
description: The Empire State survey of business conditions nosedived to -0.7 points in January from 31.9 in the prior month, the New York Federal Reserve said, reflecting fresh strains from omicron as well as ongoing supply-chain bottlenecks.

author: Greg Robb
title: Economic Report: Final Markit U.S. manufacturing PMI revised slightly lower in December
description: The final reading of the U.S. manufacturing purchasing managers index was adjusted slightly downward, to a reading of 57.7 from the "flash" reading of 57.8.

author: Greg Robb
title: Economic Report: Jobless claims jump to highest level since mid-November
description: Initial jobless claims rose 23,000 to 230,000 in the week ended Jan. 8, the Labor Department said Thursday.

author: Greg Robb
title: Economic Report: Private-sector job growth surges in December: ADP
description: Private payrolls rose by 807,000 in December, according to the ADP National Employment Report released Wednesday.

author: Anushka Dutta
title: 3 Stocks Thriving Despite a Shaky Market Environment
description: The Fed appears to be on track to increase interest rates as early as March. Furthermore, disappointing quarterly earnings reports from big U.S. banks have caused the Dow Jones Industrial...

author: Greg Robb
title: Economic Report: Industrial production edges lower in December
description: Industrial production fell 0.1% in December, the Federal Reserve reported Friday.

author: Mike Murphy
title: Futures Movers: Dow futures gain more than 100 points ahead of first trading day of 2022
description: U.S. stock futures rose Sunday, indicating a positive start for Wall Street on the first trading day of 2022.

author: Victor Reklaitis
title: : Biden to order 500 million more COVID tests for U.S. and provide free masks
description: President Joe Biden on Thursday announces that his administration is ordering another 500 million COVID-19 rapid tests kits for Americans, as he gives an update on the government's pandemic response.

author: Steve Goldstein
title: Market Snapshot: U.S. stock futures slump as 10-year yield tops 1.80%
description: A fresh selloff in bonds sent U.S. stock futures lower on Tuesday after a three-day break, with the high-growth tech sector feeling the most heat.

author: Mark DeCambre
title: Market Pulse: Panic-like selling emerges Monday as stock market tumbles and Dow skids over 1,000 points
description: Panic-like behavior takes hold on Wall Street, at least from a technical perspective, as the stock market's drop gathers steam on Monday.

author: Mike Murphy
title: Futures Movers: Stock futures rise Sunday after Wall Street’s worst week since 2020
description: The upcoming week will see a number of quarterly earnings reports from big-name companies and a meeting of the Federal Reserve.

author: Greg Robb
title: The Fed: Fed’s Harker sees ‘fair amount of tightening’ this year
description: Philadelphia Fed President Patrick Harker said Thursday he expects 'a fair amount of tightening in 2022.'

author: Jeffry Bartash
title: Economic Report: U.S. jobless claims jump 55,000 to three-month high of 286,000 as omicron bites
description: Applications for U.S. unemployment benefits surged by 55,000 last week to 286,000 and hit a more than three-month high, suggesting the omicron outbreak spurred more layoffs or people not working in early January.

author:
Bill Sarubbi, Contributor, 
 Bill Sarubbi, Contributor

title: Stocks To Trade In January
description: Here are the DJIA trading selections for the month.

author: Tomi Kilgore
title: Market Pulse: Dow’s 7-day plunge produces most oversold reading in nearly 2 years, but is it safe to buy?
description: The Dow Jones Industrial Average's seven-day plunge has produced the most oversold reading in a key technical indicator in nearly two years, but as history suggests, oversold doesn't necessarily mean over.

author: Mark DeCambre
title: Market Pulse: Tech stocks pop higher early Thursday as stock market struggles to recover from worst selloff in months to start 2022
description: U.S. stock benchmarks trade mixed Thursday morning, with tech extending declines after the worst daily drubbing for the segment of the market in months.
